summary: Margo E. Jackson was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list her position and salary during that period. The documents suggest she was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Margo E. Jackson's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee responsible for reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in these documents, her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was part of the team involved in the investigation.
